docs.text: until i saw the night of the hunter , it had been a long time since i had gasped while watching a movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: forget the others and the deep end ( which veered toward strained dramatics ) , the night of the hunter is by far the scariest movie i've seen so far this year .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: even though the movie is nearly 50 years old and there's a not drop of blood to be seen .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: luckily , the night of the hunter , charles laughton's first and final directing gig , has been restored by the ucla film and television archive and is being re-released in october 2001 .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: so , there's still plenty of time to spill your popcorn all over the place .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: robert mitchum stars as harry powell , a reverend with a nasty habit of courting and then killing widows for their cash .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his newest target is young mother willa harper ( shelley winters ) , whose murderer husband ben ( peter graves ) has hidden $10 , 000 somewhere .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: powell finds out about the stash and decides to court mrs . harper after he's released and ben is hanged .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but finding the money isn't easy for powell , who must contend with his stepchildren ( billy chapin and sally jane bruce ) , who know where the money is , but aren't telling .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the hard part about seeing a classic now is the pop culture monster has usually drawn and quartered and then flaunted all the memorable moments , thus ruining the spontaneity and adventure when we finally watch it for the first time .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: how many spoofs or salutes to the shower scene in psycho have we seen in other movies ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what about the brilliant baby stroller sequence from battleship potemkin ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( no , i'm not blaming brian de palma entirely for this sampling problem . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: yes , there are some visual elements that other directors seem to have borrowed from the night of the hunter .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: powell's " love " and " hate " knuckle tattoos obviously influenced spike lee in do the right thing ( remember radio raheem ? ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and powell's black suit , with black tie and white shirt , could have shaped quentin tarantino's early visual style .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: seeing the night of the hunter for the first time , i was amazed at how much it crackled with wicked wit and fright and how much intensity was intact .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: you can now sign me up as president of the robert mitchum fan club .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he plays the role with a controlled malice that induces unease every time he appears .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he's like the senior class president with an evil streak .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: if i ever need to stay awake , i'll just picture him crooning , " leaning . . .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: leaning . . . . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: any actor who wants to play a character with a touch of evil should study his performance the way a rabbinical student studies the torah .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and credit must be handed out to laughton and cinematographer stanley cortez , who create a series of haunting , surreal shadowy images over the rural depression-era backdrop .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a testament to both men that they're able to invigorate what has become a hackneyed storyline ( kids harassed by evil guardians ) by sticking to the old maxim that we're more scared by what we don't see .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: screenwriter and legendary film critic james agee does a beautiful job giving shape and substance to an array of supporting characters : the drunk birdie ( james gleason ) who's haunted by his wife , and the spoons ( evelyn varden and walt spoon ) whose marriage has become a verbal vaudeville act .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the only lapse is the movie's third act , when pearl and john run away from home and find a home with the motherly , bible-reading mrs . cooper ( lillian gish ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: her showdown with powell is memorable -- a battle done with dueling hymns .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , the whole segment feels a little rushed and underdone , but it's still a thrill seeing the queen of the silent film era handling a shotgun .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: do yourself favor and don't miss this if it comes to a nearby theater .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: note : a series of revealing , but overlong , outtakes preceded the movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the highlights included the legendary laughton ( who sounds eerily like mr . pitt from seinfeld ) running winters' lines with mitchum , and the adorable , tiny bruce having trouble descending a coal pile .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: hours more of such footage exists , as laughton liked to keep the cameras constantly rolling .
